X.i.1.7.a
.
Award Criteria for the Medal of Honor
The Medal of Honor is the highest and most prestigious personal military decoration that may be awarded to recognize Veterans who have distinguished themselves by acts of valor during specifically defined combat or combat-related service.  It is awarded by the President of the United States on behalf of Congress.
References
:  For more information on
award of the Medal of Honor for members of the
Army, see
10 U.S.C. 7271
naval service, including the Navy and Marine Corps, see
10 U.S.C. 8291
Air Force or Space Force, see
10 U.S.C. 9271
, and
Coast Guard, see
14 U.S.C. 2732
, and
handling claims for Medal of Honor pension, see
M21-1, Part XIII, Subpart i, 6
.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, Chapter 1 - Priority Processing Programs and Special Requirements
